newsitem.title: USA: Sensormatic says Checkpoint will halt ads.
newsitem.headline: Sensormatic says Checkpoint will halt ads.

text.p: Sensormatic Electronics Corp said Thursday that Checkpoint Systems Deutschland GmbH, the German affiliate of Checkpoint Systems Inc, will stop disseminating information that Sensormatic had alleged false or misleading as a result of a formal cease and desist decree issued by a German court.

Under the terms of the decree, Checkpoint will cease disseminating certain information about Sensormatic's acousto-magnetic technology and its performance, supposed health hazards, and system suitability for "source tagging," the process of putting anti-theft tags on consumer goods at the point of manufacture or packaging.
The company said that as part of the decree, Checkpoint will also refrain from disseminating certain disputed information about its own products.

Checkpoint's cease and desist decree follows a lawsuit filed by Sensormatic in the German courts in August, 1996. The decree, said Sensormatic, was agred upon immediately before the German court would have rendered its decision.
Sensormatic is a supplier of electronic security systems to the retail, commercial and industrial marketplaces.
